intro: Melastoma martinicense, commonly known as the redroot mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
